tasks.task: Conducting precision irrigation research at CIMMET's research station near Obregon, Mexico.
subtasks: Managing water irrigation to simulate various weather conditions (e.g., drought, monsoon).
Planting wheat genotypes in different tillage treatments (zero tillage and normal tilling).
Comparing wheat yields and grain quality between zero tillage and normal tilling under controlled water stress.
Using combine harvesters for grain collection during early harvest stages.
Analyzing grain results to determine yield differences and adaptability under water stress.
Evaluating the impact of tillage methods on wheat yield resilience in semi-arid conditions.

tasks.task: Observing wheat development during the growing season.
subtasks: Monitoring wheat growth visually for initial signs of stress or viability.
Noting differences in wheat appearance (e.g., greenness) between conventional and no-till fields.
Recognizing indications of water stress compensation in different wheat lines.

tasks.task: Harvesting and analyzing grains for yield assessment.
subtasks: Operating combine harvesters to collect grain samples from experimental plots.
Conducting detailed grain analysis to quantify yield under varying treatments.
Comparing grain characteristics between zero tillage and tilled plots subjected to water stress.
